title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have formed a new defensive pairing, improving the Bruins' defensive performance.
The Bruins allowed just one 5-on-5 goal against top NHL lines since McAvoy-Zadorov's partnership began.
Boston defeated the Carolina Hurricanes 2-1, limiting them to one high-danger scoring chance in their matchup.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman led the Bruins to a 2-1 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes with 27 saves.
Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games for the first time, posting a .933 save percentage with wins against the Islanders and Sabres.
Head coach Marco Sturm suggests a more balanced goalie rotation between Swayman and Korpisalo for the ongoing NHL season.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter offseason with budget room before hitting the luxury tax; possible for high-profile player acquisitions.
Key players like Alex Bregman and Dustin May set to become free agents; team decisions on options pending.
Red Sox need upgrades at infield positions and right-handed hitters; potential trade discussions for pitchers initiated.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty, CBS analyst, will call his third Patriots game of the regular season against the Falcons.
McCourty notes surprise at the Patriots' 6-2 record and Drake Maye's performance as a potential MVP candidate.
Drake Maye has led the Patriots with remarkable games, including a 21 of 23 passing game against the Titans.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots are reportedly interested in Dolphins' edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the NFL trade deadline.
The Dolphins are seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips amid trade talks with several teams.
Phillips ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers and has three sacks this season despite past Achilles injury.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei is benched for the third consecutive Bruins game as Hampus Lindholm returns from injury.
Coach Marco Sturm emphasizes Lohrei should use his benching as motivation and a learning experience.
The Bruins have found defensive success with Nikita Zadorov and Charlie McAvoy, limiting opponents to one goal in recent games.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons enter Sunday's game against Patriots with a 3-4 record, aiming for a playoff push.
Michael Penix, returning as Falcons starting QB, struggles in outdoor environments; Sunday will be coldest start.
Falcons boast strong defense, ranking second in NFL for yards allowed; standout cornerback A.J. Terrell leads secondary.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single, helping the Dodgers secure a 3-1 victory over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a pivotal defensive play, ensuring the Dodgers' win and forcing a Game 7 in the World Series.
Betts, struggling previously, was moved in the lineup; manager Dave Roberts praised his ability to perform under pressure.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff and riders celebrated Halloween with costumes and candy distribution on the T.
Boston Police reported Halloween festivities in East Boston, including a 'Trunk or Treat' event.
Boston Medical Center NICU dressed babies in handmade costumes, including superheroes and Celtics champions.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 Powerball ticket sold in Marlborough, Mass., remains unclaimed since the Nov. 20, 2024, drawing.
The winning numbers for the unclaimed Powerball ticket are 16-30-60-62-64, with a Powerball of 25.
If unclaimed by Nov. 20, the prize money will be distributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns.
